Row.Text: Placing this glyph creates visibility from a plot with range equal to the Caster's Divination Mod / 5. The caster's Divination Mod also determines the strength of the glyph which must be overcome to dispel it. Great people are visible to the Seeing Eye Glyph.

Reveals nearby plot-based magic effects. Number of plots tested equals the caster's Divination Mod, spiraling out from caster. Once detected, the plot effect will remain visible to the casting player.

Removes hostile glyphs, runes and wards from nearby plots. The spell removes strength points from these plot effects until the caster's Abjuration Mod has been used up. The effect spirals out from caster's present location up to a 3-plot range.

Destroys one or more conjured, summoned or called units that are hostile to the player. The sum of the unit power will be equal to or less than the caster's Abjuration Mod. Does not work against reanimated or raised undead.

Creates an inscription on the caster's plot that can protect against blight and breach. The strength of the resulting Ward is equal to the caster's Abjuration Mod, which must be overcome by a hostile caster attempting to blight or breach the plot. Experience is gained and mana used when the Ward is placed and when it is expended to protect the plot.

Causes time to stop for all other units for a number of turns equal to the caster's Abjuration Mod divided by 15 (rounded down). During these turns the caster can cast spells or perform any other actions. This spell uses 100 Mana for each turn of the time stop.

Creates an inscription on the caster's plot that will explode when an enemy unit enters the plot. The strength of the rune equals the caster's Evocation Mod. Experience is gained and mana used when the Rune is placed and when it is triggered by an enemy unit.
Gives the caster a range 2 attack with strength equal to the caster's Evocation Modifier.

Gives the caster a range 2 attack with strength equal to the caster's Evocation Modifier. The Plasma Bolt may stun the target rendering them immobile for one turn (chance to avoid stun is target level divided by caster Evocation Modifier).

This spell creates a tear in the fabric of Ã‰a, a breach from which blight spreads and demons spawn. The tear appears at the caster's position or, if cast from a Tower, at a distance up to the caster's Evocation Mod. The caster's Evocation Mod must overcome protection from Living Terrain and/or Protective Ward if these are present.

Plasma Bolts fire from the caster at all enemy units within 2-plot range, each acting with strength equal to the caster's Evocation Modifier and having a chance of stunning the target for 1 turn (chance to avoid stun is target level divided by caster Evocation Modifier).

Blights a single plot, either at the caster's current position or, if cast from a Tower, at a distance up to the caster's Transmutation Mod. The caster's Transmutation Mod must overcome protection from Living Terrain and/or Protective Ward if these are present.
Gives the caster a range 1 attack with strength equal to the caster's Transformation Modifier.
Adds Hex to an adjacent enemy unit lowering strength by 20%. Chance of wearing off each turn is equal to 1 / caster's Conjuration Modifier.
Gives the caster a range 2 attack with strength equal to two-thirds of the caster's Conjuration Modifier. Magic Missiles can fly over obstructing terrain.

Conjures a single monster with total power up to the caster's Conjuration Mod x 3. The monster is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the monster engages in combat.
Magic projectiles shoot out from the caster at all enemy units within two plots. Each projectile has strength equal to the caster's Conjuration Modifier and can fly over obstructing terrain.

Reanimates a number of Skeletons and/or Zombies with total power up to the caster's Necromancy Mod x 2. Reanimated Dead are not bound to any spellcaster. They have a 1/3 chance of un-animating and a 1/6 chance of becoming hostile each turn.

Raises a number of Skeletons and/or Zombies with total power up to the caster's Necromancy Mod x 3. Raised Dead are bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time they engage in combat (the Dead are nonsentient and do not, themselves, gain experience).

Places a Death Rune on the caster's current plot with strength equal to the caster's Necromancy Mod. This rune kills or drains life energy from an enemy unit entering the plot. It will kill the unit outright if the rune's strength exceeds the unit's power and experience. Otherwise, this amount is deducted from the unit's experience, which will lose levels and (random) promotions accordingly. Experience is gained and mana used when the Rune is placed and when it is triggered by an enemy unit.

Transforms the caster into a Lich. The Lich is immortal and will regenerate at its Tower if killed. The caster must have Necromancy Mod equal to or greater than her own level. This spell uses mana (and provides xp) equal to 100 times the caster's level. The spell can be cast only in the caster's Tower.

A thin green ray connects caster with one living unit up to range 2, draining life energy from the target. The ray strikes with only strength 1, but drains the caster's Necromancy Modifier first from target experience and then (if target reduced to 0 experience) the target's hit points.
Causes multiple Energy Drain spells to spring forth from the caster at all enemy living units within three plots.

Summons a number of Abyssal Creatures with total power up to the caster's Conjuration Modifier x 3. The creatures are bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the creatures engages in combat. (This spell has both Divine and Arcane forms.)

Summons a single Demon, the type determined by the caster's Conjuration Modifier. The Demon is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the Demon engages in combat. (This spell has both Divine and Arcane forms.)

Summons an Archdemon. Each of the eight Archdemons can be summoned only once (by anyone), and only one can be summoned by a civilization at a time. They are summoned in succession from least (Zauri) to greatest (Aeshma). The Archdemon is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the Archdemon engages in combat. (This spell has both Divine and Arcane forms.)
Heals up to caster's Spell Modifier in hit points for same-plot or adjacent allied living unit. Priority is for unit that can use up to Modifier in healing and then for the most powerful unit.

Adds the Blessed promotion to same plot or adjacent friendly living unit, adding 10 hp per turn to natural healing. Priority is for the strongest living unit. Chance of wearing off each turn is equal to 1 / caster's Spell Modifier.

Adds the Protection from Evil promotion to one unit giving +5 hp natural healing and protecting the unit from negative spell effects like Hex, Curse and Defile. Chance of wearing off each turn is equal to 1 / caster's Spell Modifier.
Destroys one or more Undead with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier.
Destroys one or more Demons or Abyssal Creatures with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier.

Calls a number of Heaven's Guard with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier x 3. The Guard are bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the Guard engages in combat.

Calls a single Angel with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier x 3. The Angel is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the Angel engages in combat.

Calls an Archangel. Each of the twelve Archangels can be called only once (by anyone), and only one can be summoned by a civilization at a time. They are called in succession from least (Zam) to greatest (Mithra). The Angel is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the Angel engages in combat.

Damages adjacent enemy living unit up to the casterâ€™s Spell Modifier. Priority is for a unit that will be killed by the spell and then for the most powerful unit, but the casterâ€™s Spell Modifier must exceed the unitâ€™s level.

Adds the Cursed promotion to an adjacent enemy living unit, preventing all natural healing. Priority is for the strongest living unit, but the casterâ€™s Spell Modifier must exceed the unitâ€™s level. Chance of wearing off each turn is equal to 1 / casterâ€™s Spell Modifier.

Adds the Evil-Eye promotion to one unit giving -5 hp natural healing and preventing the unit from gaining beneficial effects from Bless and Protection from Evil. Chance of wearing off each turn is equal to 1 / casterâ€™s Spell Modifier.
Turns hostile Undead to the caster's control with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier.
Destroys one or more Angels or Heaven's Guard with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier.
Increases the spreading and regeneration strength of Living Terrain (forest, jungle or marsh) by the casterâ€™s Spell Modifier.
Calls a number of animals with total power up to the caster's Spell Modifier. The Animals are bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time they engage in combat.

Calls a single Tree-Ent from a Forest or Jungle with minimum strength 18; the Tree-Ent's strength is taken from the Forest or Jungle. The Tree-Ent is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time they engage in combat.

Calls a Major Spirit to fight for the spellcaster's civilization. Each Major Spirit can be called only once (by anyone), and only one can be summoned by a particular civilization at one time. The civilization must be allies with the Major Spirit with relationship of 500. The Major Spirit is bound to the caster such that the caster gains experience and uses mana each time the Major Spirit engages in combat.
Creates a forest or jungle on any valid plot adjacent to an already existing forest or jungle.
Adds Ride Like the Wind promotion to all adjacent or same plot horse-mounted units adding +2 movement.
Removes all bad bad spell effects and provides some healing to one unit.
Permanently adds the Fair Winds promotion to one nearby allied ship adding +1 movement.
Adds civilization happiness equal to the caster's modifier.
